page.title: 16RUSHBURY SCHOOL
page.content:
Full title: {RUSHBURY CHURCH OF ENGLAND {(CONTROLLED) PRIMARY SCHOOL
A plaque on the front of the school house says: {THIS SCHOOL AND ALMHOUSES WERE BUILT {AND ENDOWED BY BENJAMIN THE SEVENTH {SON OF THE LATE RICHARD AND MARY {WAINWRIGHT OF STANWAY IN THE YEAR {1821. { An attempt was made to close the school in 1980 but there was a reprieve in the summer of 1982 when children from {Cardington School} were transferred to Rushbury School.
The school now consists of an Infant class in the original building and a Junior class in a demountable classroom. Ages of children:4to 11.
